name: Introduction to Anthropology
description: A survey of the field of Anthropology, including its subdisciplines: Sociocultural Anthropology, Archaeology, Biological Anthropology, and Linguistic Anthropology

name: Introduction to Biological Anthropology
description: An overview of the field of Biological Anthropology, including its sub-disciplines: Primatology, Human Evolution, and Forensic Anthropology.

name: Quantitative Methods in Biological Anthropology
description: This course introduces students to quantitative methods for studying biological anthropology.

name: Cellular and Molecular Biology
description: A survey of the fundamentals of Cellular and Molecular Biology, including topics such as genetics, enzymology, and metabolism.

name: Evolutionary Theory
description: An introduction to evolutionary theory and its application to the study of Biological Anthropology

name: Human Anatomy and Physiology
description: An introduction to the anatomy and physiology of the human body, with particular focus on the differences between humans and other primates.

name: Paleoanthropology
description: A study of human evolution, with particular focus on the fossil evidence for human evolution.
